select t.id as id, t.name as name , t.name_en as nameEn, t.type as type, t.postcode as postcode, t.level as level, t.pid as pid, t.sorting as sorting, t.status as status, t.postage as postage, t.postage2 as postage2, t.add_postage as addPostage, t.add_postage2 as addPostage2, (select name from sys_dict where value=t.status and type = 'sys_dict_status') statusName from sys_area t where 1=1
and t.name like CONCAT("%",#{name},"%")
and t.pid = #{pid}
order by t.level desc,id asc

select t.id as id, t.name as name , t.name_en as nameEn, t.type as type, t.postcode as postcode, t.level as level, t.pid as pid, t.sorting as sorting, t.status as status, t.postage as postage, t.postage2 as postage2, t.add_postage as addPostage, t.add_postage2 as addPostage2, (select name from sys_dict where value=t.status and type = 'sys_dict_status') statusName from sys_area t where 1=1 and t.id = #{id}
